Upload Screenshot Prof. Mukesh Kumar Rohil Pilani Computer Science Professor, Department of Computer Science & Information Systems, BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus Artificial Intelligence and Expert Systems, Computer Networks, Computer Vision, Data Mining and Business Analytics, Geographical Information Systems and Remote Sensing, Pattern Recognition, Software Engineering Room No. 6120-H Department of Computer Science & Information Systems Birla Institute of Technology & Science, Pilani Pilani - 333031, Rajasthan, India rohil@pilani.bits-pilani.ac.in Phone (Desk): +91-1596-255615 Phone (Department): +91-1596-255405 Mukesh Kumar Rohil is a Professor of Computer Science & Information Systems (CSIS) at BITS Pilani. He leads the Kalipatnapu Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality Lab and the Multimedia and Human-Computer Interaction Lab there. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science & Engineering (2004), an M.E. in Systems & Information (1995), and an M.Sc. (Hons.) in Physics (1993) with a B.E. (Hons.) in Civil Engineering (1993) under the Dual Degree Program, all from BITS Pilani. His research interests lie in the domains of Artificial Intelligence, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Extended Reality, Remote Sensing, Human-Computer Interaction, Software Engineering, Business Analytics, and Computer Networks. He has been a key member driving excellence in the Off-Campus Programmes and Industry Engagement for BITS Pilani. Prof. Rohil has a number of publications (60+) in refereed journals, proceedings of conferences, conventions, workshops, and symposia of repute published/organized by IEEE, Elsevier, Springer, Taylor & Francis, ACM, ISPRS, IET, ISRS, and Indian Buildings Congress amongst others. He has a design issued and two patents filed. His research has been funded by the government as well as industries in India and abroad. He has received sanction for the grant on “Support for Entrepreneurial and Managerial Development of SMEs through Incubators” from the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME), Government of India, New Delhi and has completed a minor research project funded by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Government of India, New Delhi. He has executed and coordinated several industry-sponsored research and development projects for the Technology Innovation Centre (TIC) of BITS Pilani; the sponsors include Sabre Travel Network, Bengaluru (Subsidiary of Sabre Corporation, Southlake, TX, USA), John Deere, Pune, and RedMed Health Systems, Bengaluru. Dr. Rohil has also completed a couple of externally funded consultancy projects pertaining to Management Information Systems, apart from accomplishing several in-house projects at BITS Pilani. He is a Senior Member of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE), a Life Member of the Indian Society of Remote Sensing, and a Life Member of the Indian Society for Technical Education. He has been a reviewer for leading journals and has served on the Program/Advisory Committees of top conferences. He has delivered several invited keynotes and research talks at national venues. He has independently supervised three Ph.D. scholars and is currently supervising five. He has also (been) proactively served (serving) as a Doctoral Advisory Committee (DAC) Member for seven Ph.D. scholars and has been an external examiner for several doctoral theses/master's degree dissertations. He has supervised more than 40 Higher Degree Dissertations/Research Practices/Studies in Advanced Topics and 150 First Degree Theses/Projects having taught varied courses (27 in total) in CSIS and allied interdisciplinary area
